&ltOBJECT>.REFRESH_FIELDS() Syntax &ltOBJECT>.REFRESH_FIELDS() Description The &ltOBJECT>.REFRESH_FIELDS() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.REFRESH_FIELDS() method executes the .REFRESH() method on each field object on a layout. Limitations Desktop applications only. Example dim p as P dim t as P p = form.view("Customer") 'get a pointer to the primary table in the form t = p.Table_Get() 'start entering a new record, honoring field rules t.enter_begin(honor_field_rules) t.lastname = "Smith" t.firstname = "Simon" 'at this point, the form does not yet show the new data p.Refresh_fields()
Now the form shows the new data, but it is still in enter mode. Contrast this method with the <FORM>.RESYNCH() method which refreshes the form by re-displaying the data from the record in the record buffer. This method can only be executed if the form is in View mode. See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
